alert.note: Alert for Boone; Hendricks; Montgomery; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 4:44PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hendricks, southwestern Boone, southeastern Montgomery and northeastern Putnam Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of Crawfordsville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Hendricks, southwestern Boone, southeastern Montgomery and northeastern Putnam Counties, including the following locations... North Salem, Jamestown, Advance, New Ross, Carpentersville, Ladoga, Roachdale, and New Market. This includes Interstate 74 between mile markers 47 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
